summary: This is a memorandum from the Federal Bureau of Prisons' Metropolitan Detention Center (MDC) Brooklyn Legal Department regarding an unauthorized attempt to schedule a legal visit for inmate Ghislaine Maxwell. The document details the standard verification procedures for legal visitors and notes that a public notary's request was denied.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The subject of the memorandum; an inmate at MDC Brooklyn for whom an unauthorized legal visit was attempted to be scheduled.

persons.name: Staff Attorney
persons.context: The author of the memorandum from the MDC Brooklyn Legal Department, who details the incident and the standard procedures for legal visits.

events.title: Unauthorized Legal Visit Attempt for Maxwell
events.description: An individual attempted to schedule a legal visit for inmate Ghislaine Maxwell via the MDC Brooklyn Legal Visiting portal and follow-up emails, claiming to be a public notary. The request was denied as such visits are not approved.

locations: Metropolitan Detention Center, 80 29th Street, Brooklyn, New York 11232
keyFacts: On April 26, 2021, an individual attempted to schedule a legal visit for Ghislaine Maxwell at MDC Brooklyn, claiming to be a public notary.
The MDC Legal Department denied the request, stating that legal visits are not approved for public notaries.
Standard procedure requires the Legal Department to verify that individuals scheduling legal visits are attorneys in good standing.
Other approved visitor types include mitigation specialists, interpreters, and psychiatrists, but they must submit an application and pass a background check.
The memorandum, dated May 14, 2021, documents this incident and the attached email thread.
